header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.conv_type: Discussing, Explaining, INquiring, Anecdote telling, making arrangements, telling jokes

he's not wasting his time is he?

you have to eat them straight away
was you pleased to see that this popped up in the paper?
cos erm we were looking at them last night and I was upstairs and said ooh there's one of your questions in the paper
oh right the controversy started extra quickly
it has really cos usually something pops up doesn't it?
right what's like the the Telegraph's what is it consensus of is it a a tricky question?
or is it straight forward like? well not straightforward but
mm I think their implication is that it's erm a more challenging question
but then the paper's usually saying ooh they've been dumbed down too many people are getting high grades so whatever you do you're not going to win are you?
mm mm no the journalists the journalists they're not going to let something get in the way of a controversial story
for example when I was watching telly this morning and er Newswatch comes on I don't know whether you've ever seen Newswatch by the way?
it might be a bit too early for you
but er there was quite a number at least a dozen people had tweeted or wrote in about the the way the BBC news had portrayed Charles Kennedy's demise
by mentioning a lot about his alcohol er
that they they played too much on it and what have you
so they they then had to bring out they always have to bring somebody out from
their the they brought out the journalist editor and he has the title of er obituary controller

yes which I will go on to but anyhow er he said that it was well known er Kennedy's alcoholism
and er you know he had to defend it and I thought he he defended it very good but there's always these people
who are going to come come at you from
oh you can't please all the people all of the time can you?

he said it was well known and on top of that his his wife had said that that was the cause of it really
and er it it was people were saying that alcoholism is an illness and he said it is not an illness such as er cancer or er er well he mentioned something else
he said it's it's what you do to yourself it's almost self-inflicted and it's right isn't it?

and yet people still continue to smoke still people still die of lung cancer
but they can't er say that being an alcoholic is an illness as such er as I say I thought he defended he did it better than what I've just said there but

they er there was at least a dozen letters and more

well it was supposed to be the it was a female news reader that I had never seen before she was reading it out and she said she didn't realise it was only a practice I can hardly believe that
but why was it why was it like that?
what do you mean why was it?
how how did it how did it get out then from that?
because she blabbed on social media

if you said Tay Bridge it meant the queen mother had died and
everything was in place just to

oh I knew it would be you

this is walking down said to me at Christmas just after Christmas she said you you look a bit er a bit down like she said what is it? is something? well I says it it is really I says everywhere I look I says there seems to be job looking back at me and I don't like it cos I say I know I'm not gonna get some of them done so after a little discussion we decided we'll make a list of these jobs and put a cross on those I can't do and put a tick against those I can do and those I can't do we'll get someone else to do them and pay for it good idea that was the plan so I said now then er in morning you will see a plumbers van outside our house and he's coming to look at our toilet and I went it's not

that the I can't do them on the toilet I said I fitted the whole toilet and pipes and everything in so I I could do it but I'm not gonna be able to do it for for various reasons so I said we'll pay for it now I said what I want to show you I says all this vegetation your garden coming over here look I says I can cut them off I can cut that but when it's gets to that er conifer tree there I said I'm not gonna be able to do and I said I don't think you can neither so I think you're going to have to get somebody in to to see to that so he says mm do you know anybody you know? how much would it be? that's his first line really how much would it be? like which is not a bad line how much would it be? er so I said well you already do know somebody because you get to come and cut the hedge and it wants cutting now don't it?
you know it's as high as this
now I don't mean a bit or topiary I mean

it wants a good slice so I says ask him yeah he said I'll I'll have a word with my mum about it well I says he's had two or three letters in the hou in in the paper and he's really got their backs up of Hull city council I'll tell you er had the latest one in weren't he'?
and he was he really gave them

well he said will it be expensive?
